title: ECCV
subtitle: This ECCV policy issues paper provides an overview of the multiple and complex challenges faced by Victorian migrant and refugee communities in accessing the NDIS and understanding the disability support system. Please read and share: http://ow.ly/1QSe50x7tc9¬†pic.twitter.com/hQGBefPkry

title: NAPHLtd
subtitle: It's International Day for Tolerance, promoting respect, dialogue, cooperation & tolerance of all cultures. On this day we're celebrating NAPHL's Refugee Health Nurses & the important work they do for people who have arrived in Nth Qld under the Aust Gvt's Humanitarian Program. pic.twitter.com/lndazrGdOy

title: The Pantograph Punch
subtitle: "I am a stateless Kurdish-Iranian refugee. Land is what is most precious for Kurdish people and that is what has been taken away from me". Portrait of Emad, a Manus Island refugee who chose sand as his symbolic object, by Hoda Afshar, 2018. On display at Gus Fisher Gallery. pic.twitter.com/ITjgyLuPcM

title: Claire Farrugia
subtitle: ‚ÄúShe looks at the paper, looks at me, looks at the paper, looks at me‚Äù Trans people almost immediately fall into a system of statelessness when seeking asylum. Migration/refugee studies needs to account for trans experiences @Obsqueer #QueerDisplacementspic.twitter.com/Pa7u8i8MVP

title: Dr Melanie O'Brien

title: Tyler Riordan
subtitle: @joydamousi suggesting to #AAHSymposium audience that until we formally recognise indigenous peoples, and truth-tell on refugees, #Australia has lost its moral compass. I tend to agree. Coming soon to @RadioNational #bigideas @HumanitiesAUpic.twitter.com/5xUBRA2CMT

title: Ingrid Mason
subtitle: Joy Damousi : Being Humane: A Contested History. The degradation of being humane in Australian politics.
